physical_appearance: "This print shows a half-dressed man wielding two swords. To his right are soldiers marching. A green bottle is seen in the foreground, with the subtext ""Anggur 3 pendekar This print is an advertisement for Colibrita. On the right is a lady clad in a batik dress. She wears a crown, floral ear rings, bangles, and holds  a mirror in her right hand. She is surrounded by flora and fauna. To the left of the print is a label that lists the products carried by the brand.
sgcool_label_text: NA Tanah Impian (Dream Land) is a series of prints based on images drawn from Indonesian popular culture, spanning 100 years. The project was conceived in 2014, the year of the elections in Indonesia when nationalist rhetoric dominated public consciousness, Artist collective Krack Studio sifted through a mass of research and archival material, eventually selecting 24 images that referenced the idea of the Indonesian Dream and / or told an interesting story about changing definitions of the ‘Nation’. Ranging from political posters to advertisements, comic strips, movie posters and magazines, these images, reconstructed and re-imagined by the artist collective, chronicle Indonesia’s evolving aspirations, desires and identity, as well as how Indonesia has been perceived and imaged for the ‘Western’ gaze.
